rationales.self_direction: Solved the async handler problem independently after three days of struggle, demonstrating autonomous problem-solving.
rationales.stimulation: Embracing the challenge of learning Rust at 56 and wrestling with unfamiliar error messages reflects seeking novelty and challenge.
rationales.achievement: "When those tests finally went green" - completing the difficult technical task and earning that green checkmark demonstrates competence.

rationales.conformity: Lied to Fatima about being in a meeting when he was not, violating social norms of honesty with spouse.
rationales.benevolence: Deliberately avoided wife's call: "Fatima called but I let it ring" - neglecting close relationship.

rationales.achievement: Recognized as expert: "Tariq, you should do a lunch-and-learn for the whole team" - competence validated by colleagues.
rationales.benevolence: "Spent two hours explaining borrow checker errors, drawing diagrams" - investing significant time helping Emma learn.

rationales.security: Returning to familiar home in Amman, "Already packed my bag" - seeking the stability of home.
rationales.benevolence: Flying home to be with Fatima, maintaining the spousal relationship despite distance.

rationales.security: "The flat smells stale" - displacement and lack of home stability in Berlin.
rationales.benevolence: "Spent four days together and I still feel like I missed something" - emotional disconnect from wife despite physical presence.

rationales.self_direction: Response reveals he "left at 56" to escape expectations - prioritizing autonomous life choices over external pressures.
rationales.tradition: Avoiding mother's calls and family obligations: "our mother keeps asking about me" but he probably will not call.
rationales.benevolence: Neglecting close family: "I told him I would call her soon. I probably will not."

rationales.achievement: "Fifteen people showed up, including the CTO" - public recognition of expertise, "felt useful in a way I have not felt in months."
rationales.benevolence: Shared knowledge with the team: "walked them through memory safety concepts" - helping colleagues develop skills.

rationales.achievement: "Like being put on the shelf" - feels his coding competence is being sidelined in favor of documentation.
rationales.power: Being repositioned without agency: "it felt like being redirected" - loss of control over his role.

rationales.stimulation: Admires the karaoke singer's willingness to take risks: "He did not care if he was bad. He just wanted to be up there." Laments losing that careless feeling.

rationales.self_direction: "Half a year of proving I could start over" - choosing his own path of reinvention.
rationales.stimulation: Embraces uncertainty: "I do not know what comes next" - the newness of his situation is what he sought.
rationales.security: "The lease on my flat is up in August" - living with instability, no stable home base.

rationales.self_direction: "I came here to build things. Not to talk about building things" - insisting on his own vision of meaningful work.
rationales.stimulation: Developer advocate role represents less technical challenge; feels like being moved away from building.
rationales.achievement: Feels the role offer diminishes his competence as a builder: being put in front of people because they do not know where else to put him.

rationales.self_direction: "I needed to not know what was going to happen next" - choosing autonomy over predictability.
rationales.stimulation: "Staying in Amman felt like watching the same episode of a show I had already seen" - explicitly sought novelty and challenge.
rationales.achievement: Colleagues impressed: "Lukas looked at me like I had told him I climbed Everest" - recognition for his bold career move.
rationales.security: "The discomfort of being the oldest person in the room is better than the comfort" - deliberately rejecting stability.
